column4: hello guys i have problem with my usb modem and cd rom when i connect them they dont show in /media or desktop but in emsg i find them  but when i connect usb flash memory its detect it and can check the files in side it
only storage devices are automounted in /media

your usb modem is proly not going to work...but with your cdrom drive i suggest plugging it in all by itself, and putting a cdrom in it....if that doesnt work then have it plugged in when you turn your computer on
can you provide a prodcut page for your modem then please
:http://www.bandrich.com/download03.aspx?id=2&c=25&lang=3 but im using ubuntu no drive for it
im looking at it now...one sec
as i said unless your modem uses the international standards of usb mass storage then it wont mount it without drivers
: aha  so i should forget about makeing it work in ubuntu >
that wasnt the product page...you gave me the driver page
i dont see anything there about it being a storage device.
: so dude what i should do
try the eepc driver but you will have to compile the drivers most likley...can't garuntee anything, maybe you can start a protest infront of the manufactures operation
they are who will be responsible for getting it working in a linux flavour of your choice
try searching through the ubuntu wiki & forum as well for your device vendor code and product id
plug it in, in terminal type : lsusb, then look for the device and get more info on it with : lsusb -s vendorcode:productcode -vvv
: im searching  thank u man for helping
